page.title: 13PLACE NAMES
page.content: Most of Cornwall's names are Cornish or English, Cornish are older. English names are easy to understand, like Coldwind Cross or Quenchwell. Many Cornish names start with 'tre' (farm), 'chy'(house)or 'nans'(valley). Examples in our area are Tregoose,farm with a wood; Chycowling, house of Mr Cowling and Nangiles. 'Wheal' means means mine, like Wheal Baddon. The name of our village(Devoran)means 'waters'; Cusgarne is'wood of cranes' and Bissoe 'birch trees', although no longer wooded. Belmont is neither English nor Corn- ish but French, and means 'beautiful hill'. Splat is an English dialect word meaning a plot of ground - Green- splat and Fernsplat. Downs were rough grazing land and Carnon Downs means the downs belonging to the farm of Carnon.
